title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Software Engineer

If you are a Senior Software Engineer with embedded experience, please read on!

---Onsite in Petaluma | Full-Time/Permanent---

We are a leading provider of innovative medical solutions designed to save lives in the most challenging environments. Our products range from advanced trauma simulation systems to life-saving medical equipment, empowering military, law enforcement, and emergency medical professionals to perform at their best when it matters most. With a commitment to quality, training, and real-world performance, we strive to make a difference in critical moments.

This role will demonstrate and apply principles and procedures associated with the creation, maintenance, and enhancement of custom embedded applications for the company's systems with a focus on progressive application software design and development. Provide prototype, new development, and maintenance programming support for new and existing custom embedded applications using traditional programming languages and state of the art development tools.
Skills
‚Ä¢ Embedded C / C++
‚Ä¢ Visual Studio
‚Ä¢ Microcontroller-based embedded systems
‚Ä¢ Serial, USB, Ethernet, CAN, or similar communication protocols
‚Ä¢ Version control (Git preferred)

Plus skills:
‚Ä¢ C# (.NET Framework 4.x and later)
‚Ä¢ Familiar with Altium
‚Ä¢ Ability to read and interpret schematics and PCB layouts.
‚Ä¢ Experience collaborating with electrical engineers on embedded hardware designs.

‚Ä¢ Design, develop, test, implement, and maintain program code/modules/objects/interfaces
based on defined requirements and specifications.

application software.

‚Ä¢ Prepare inputs to project status reports.
‚Ä¢ Participate in full software development lifecycle.
‚Ä¢ Employ configuration management tools to manage code development, implementation and
test.

‚Ä¢ Lead or participate in the application of structured techniques and development methodologies
to formulate software component architectures and software designs.
‚Ä¢ Evaluate and recommend application development tools.

- Competitive base salary with bonus!
- 401k matching
- PTO
- Full benefits including medical, dental, and vision
- Opportunity for professional growth
- Awesome Glassdoor review
- Great company culture and work-life balance!
- Much more!

So, if you are a Senior Electrical Engineer with experience, please apply today!

title: (USA) Senior, Software Engineer: Apollo GraphQL
description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...Join our team as a Senior Software Engineer and help shape the future of customer payments on Walmart.com! You'll design and build scalable microservices and APIs that power seamless, secure, and high-impact transactions for millions of shoppers worldwide. This is your chance to work on mission-critical systems at massive scale, driving innovation in digital payments.

About Team:
Our team works closely with our US stores and eCommerce business to better serve customers by empowering team members, stores, and merchants with technological innovation. From groceries and entertainment to sporting goods and crafts, Walmart U.S. offers an extensive selection that our customers value, whether they shop online at Walmart.com, through one of our mobile apps, or in-store. Focus areas include customers, stores and employees, in-store service, merchant tools, merchant data science, and search and personalization.

What you'll do:
‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and maintain highly scalable microservices to support secure and efficient customer payments.
‚Ä¢ Build and optimize APIs using Node.js, Apollo GraphQL, and JavaScript, ensuring high performance, security, and reliability.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, design, and backend services) to define, design, and deliver new payment features.
‚Ä¢ Diagnose, debug, and resolve complex technical issues efficiently to ensure a smooth payment experience for millions of customers.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to system architecture and best practices, driving technical excellence and scalability in payment infrastructure.

What you'll bring:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in software engineering, with a strong focus on scalable microservices and API development.
‚Ä¢ 3+ years of hands-on experience with GraphQL, including schema design, resolvers, query optimization, and best practices for performance and security.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Node.js and JavaScript, with experience in backend development, API design, and distributed systems.
‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and system design experience, with the ability to build solutions that handle high-traffic payments at scale.
‚Ä¢ A collaborative mindset, working effectively with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact features in a fast-paced environment.
If youre passionate about building high-performance, secure, and scalable payment solutions, wed love to hear from you!

About Walmart Global Tech
Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. Thats what we do at Walmart Global Tech. Were a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity experts and service professionals within the worlds leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail. Walmarts culture is a competitive advantage, and its fostered by being together. Working together in person allows us to collaborate, align quickly and innovate with greater speed. We use our campuses to create purposeful connection rooted in deepening understanding and investing in the development of our associates.
Our hubs: Walmart is a global company with offices across the United States and around the world. Our global headquarters is in Bentonville, Arkansas, with primary hubs in the San Francisco Bay area and New York/New Jersey.

Benefits:
Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

Equal Opportunity Employer:
Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions while being welcoming of all people.

It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. title: Software Engineer III
description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...It‚Äôs an exciting time to join the Walmart journey. Want to use design and coding skills to solve real-life large-scale problems impacting millions of lives? EBS provides people and business shared services globally for all of Walmart‚Äôs lines of businesses including People, Finance, Digital Experience and Global Governance. About Team: Our Imports tech team within EBS Finance department is responsible for carrying out various financial operations connected with import goods shipment. These tasks include managing payments for both supplier and non-supplier companies involved in these shipments, creating financial entries (GL) and posting them to SAP, managing the import PO lifecycle from a financial perspective, and conducting end-to-end reconciliation of processed payments. What you'll do:
‚Ä¢ Playing part of an engineering team in software design and implementation, upholding our architectural patterns, design patterns, coding standards, quality principles, and customer focus.
‚Ä¢ Putting our data to work by building a world class data foundation that supports applications, analytics and AI capabilities that solve real world financial problems.
‚Ä¢ Explore Walmart‚Äôs enterprise data ecosystems to identify opportunities.
‚Ä¢ Perform research, EDA, and root cause analysis on data discrepancies to improve data models.
‚Ä¢ Transform data from warehouses and lakes into models using SQL, Python, and dbt to surface missed recoveries.
‚Ä¢ Building event driven and microservice powered applications to interact with SQL and No-SQL Databases to achieve Walmart‚Äôs Finance modernization efforts.
‚Ä¢ Working across multiple lines of business to modernize processes, helping teams deliver features at a rapid pace to ensure we build scalable and sustainable value-stream products for our business and associates.
‚Ä¢ Partnering with Infrastructure and Platform teams to identify gaps and opportunities to invest time and resources to improve delivery across the organization
‚Ä¢ Improving the software technology environment through application of industry best practices; researching the latest developments in software technology applicable to the enterprise; analyzing industry best practices; and benchmarking internal processes and solutions against industry technology and trends
‚Ä¢ Assisting in the development, training, and mentoring of associates by providing guidance, and building a team-based work environment; leveraging data to establish performance goals and working with management to improve the working environment;
‚Ä¢ Promoting and supporting company policies, procedures, mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by training and providing direction to others in their use and application.
‚Ä¢ Ensure business needs are being met by evaluating the ongoing effectiveness of current plans, programs, and initiatives; consulting with business partners, managers, co-workers, or other key stakeholders; soliciting, evaluating, and applying suggestions for improving efficiency and cost effectiveness; and participating in and supporting community outreach events.
What you'll bring:
‚Ä¢ Experience in building and modernizing a broad array of technology spanning both front and backend development.
‚Ä¢ Experience with SQL and no-SQL Databases such as Redis, SQLite, Milvus, DB2, MS SQL, Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Google BigQuery.
‚Ä¢ Strong expertise in data modeling, SQL, Python, and dbt; experience with EDA, audit-focused data transformations, and maintaining ELT systems with CI/CD pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with AI/ML techniques and information extraction (OCR, email analytics, Document AI) is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Experience with AI, Generative AI, Data Science or probabilistic mathematics.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience with design and testing patterns.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to lead and participate in medium- to large-scale projects by writing and reviewing code, reviewing project requirements, translating requirements into technical solutions by partnering with the product management, project management, business, and user experience teams. Prepare requested information and obtain cross-function approvals.
‚Ä¢ Strong experience with cloud native technology and platform capabilities.
‚Ä¢ Clear, concise communication skills with strong leadership and influential abilities.
‚Ä¢ Ability to multitask between several different requirements and features concurrently.
‚Ä¢ Superior analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude.
‚Ä¢ Ability to perform in a team environment.
‚Ä¢ Have a true passion about Technology.
‚Ä¢ Applied exposure to Agile Methodologies.
‚Ä¢ Strong development experience in multiple modern programming languages and frameworks such as NodeJs, Python, ReactJS, Java, Flask, Electrode, NextJS.
About Walmart Global Tech Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That‚Äôs what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We‚Äôre a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world‚Äôs leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail. Flexible, hybrid work: We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives. Benefits: Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more. Equal Opportunity Employer: Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer ‚Äì By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions ‚Äì while being inclusive of all people. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
Description:

Company Overview

At Opus IVS, our mission is to drive advancement in the automotive industry by assisting customers with complex vehicle repairs. Guided by our core values of Customer Focus, Innovation, Collaboration & Teamwork, and a Results-Driven approach, we continually strive to develop advanced technology that empowers us to fulfill our mission.

Opus IVS technology & products has been a leader in the industry since the late 90s. Opus IVS offers modern collision shops an integrated platform of leading diagnostics and calibration solutions, anchored by expert technicians and cutting edge, patented technology.

Position Summary

The Software Engineer Intern will contribute to improving system reliability, performance, and security while developing hands-on experience in modern software development practices. They will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to enhance system monitoring, streamline deployments, and drive innovation, all while focusing on delivering exceptional customer experiences.

Responsibilities:
Assist in designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software applications used in automotive diagnostics. Collaborate with engineering teams to implement new features and resolve software issues. Participate in code reviews to learn best practices and contribute to improving code quality. Write clear, maintainable, and well-documented code under the guidance of senior engineers. Support troubleshooting, debugging, and performance optimization of applications. Help with creating and executing unit tests to ensure reliability and accuracy of software. Contribute to technical documentation for internal processes, features, and tools. Work with cross-functional teams (product, QA, operations) to understand requirements and deliver solutions. Other duties as assigned.

Requirements:

Qualifications:
Pursuing a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field. Experience with program languages and frameworks such as .NET C#, C++, Java, or similar. Basic knowledge of database systems (e.g., SQL, NoSQL) and database performance optimization. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) for documentation, data analysis, and reporting. Strong problem-solving and debugging skills with attention to detail. Ability to quickly learn new technologies, frameworks, and tools. Effective communication and collaboration skills.

WHAT WE OFFER:
Competitive Pay: We know your value and were not afraid to pay for it. We offer a competitive total compensation plan including salary, bonuses, tuition reimbursement, and a match contribution to your 401k. Time Off: Besides our competitive paid time off package, employees receive paid holidays and floating holidays. Benefits: We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including all the necessities such as medical, dental, and vision. Opportunity: to be a part of a fast-growing company working to make the world safer!

We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of the job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk or hear. title: R&D Engineering Intern ‚Äì Hydrogen Systems
description:
About The Company

Fourier is working on making on-site Hydrogen universally accessible. Our breakthrough architecture enables highly modular and fully automated electrolyzers that scale to any size and optimize efficiency at all loads. We are on a mission to transition the global energy landscape towards a purely sustainable and emission-free future.

About The Role

This internship will involve supporting the design and validation of our commercial product. The intern will contribute to the design of a regenerative drying and purification system to enable efficient and continuous production of high-purity hydrogen. Working closely with an R&D engineer, the intern will characterize thermal/separation processes, develop control systems, and optimize operating parameters to satisfy key reliability and cost constraints. As the directly responsible individual overseeing an experimental test station, the intern will develop a data analysis framework to provide key insights into long-term physicochemical phenomena. The role may involve working with vendors to design and develop custom components.

Requirements
‚Ä¢ Currently pursuing or recently completed a B.S. or M.S. in Chemical / Materials / Mechanical / Environmental Engineering, Chemistry, Physics or similar
‚Ä¢ Comfortable rolling up their sleeves to work with basic mechanical/electrical components, troubleshoot independently, and motivated to take ownership (agency) of hands-on lab work
‚Ä¢ Strong fundamentals and problem-solving intuition in one or more of the following areas: thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, heat and mass transfer, reaction kinetics, phase equilibria
‚Ä¢ Thrives in a fast-moving environment and can learn, iterate, and execute with velocity
‚Ä¢ Must be available to start in February/March 2026 and work on-site in Mountain View, CA
‚Ä¢ Highly organized with strong attention to detail and a commitment to following through (accountability)
‚Ä¢ Clear, thoughtful communicator who works well on small, collaborative teams

title: Embedded Engineering Internship - Summer 2026
description:
Company

Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.

Job Area

Interns Group, Interns Group > Interim Engineering Intern - SW

General Summary

About Qualcomm

Qualcomm relentlessly innovates transforming businesses, enriching lives and fortifying societies. Our solutions are pivotal in crafting a smarter, interconnected world. Building on our nearly 40-year history of era-defining technology breakthroughs, we deliver leading-edge AI, high performance, lower-power computing, and unrivaled connectivity. We‚Äôre proud to be the partner of choice to many of the world‚Äôs largest enterprises. Together with our ecosystem partners, we enable next-generation digital transformation. Join Us in Shaping the Future

At Qualcomm, we're committed to engineering human progress by delivering intelligent computing everywhere. We're passionate about harnessing the power of technology to transform industries and improve lives. Our early career programs offer limitless opportunities for growth, mentorship, and meaningful work. By joining our team, you'll be part of a community that's pushing the boundaries of what's possible in AI, computing, and connectivity. With a global footprint spanning over 30 countries, you'll have the chance to collaborate with diverse talent and contribute to projects that are shaping the future of technology.

Our early career programs are designed to attract inventive minds, offering a platform to contribute to our long-term innovation pipeline. You'll be part of a community that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. Our programs provide real-world experience, technical skills, and professional development opportunities, empowering you to make a meaningful impact and achieve your career goals. Role Overview

As a Qualcomm Embedded Engineering Intern, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to push the boundaries of what exists and help establish the new standards for tomorrow. You will innovate as an equal contributor on teams of world-class engineers to develop, implement, and maintain software for the most complex wireless devices in the industry today. You will leverage your computer science or engineering degree to make an immediate impact on the software development life cycle of one of Qualcomm‚Äôs numerous software technologies.

This internship supports the Embedded Engineering track. Based on your resume you will be aligned to projects within this track.

Minimum Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Currently enrolled in a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree program in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, or a related field.
‚Ä¢ Must be available for 11‚Äì14 weeks during Summer 2026 (May‚ÄìSeptember).

‚Ä¢ 1+ years of academic experience with programming languages such as C, C++, Python, etc.

Preferred Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Embedded programming in C/C++/Assembly & operating system knowledge

‚Ä¢ Embedded microcontroller programming, experience developing device drivers
‚Ä¢ Real-time embedded programming in C/C++/Assembly for general purpose and heterogeneous processors including GPUs and DSPs
‚Ä¢ Communication systems, communication theory, digital signal processing (DSP, embedded firmware)

Qualcomm‚Äôs Internship Program

Our interns join world-class teams to help define and build what is next for mobility and the world. You‚Äôll be paired with a mentor with visibility to your project and team, receive support from your manager, and have access to the entire Qualcomm employee community to ensure your success. To round out your summer internship, we host professional development workshops, social events, cross-functional speaker sessions, and an executive speaker series. Internship opportunities may be available in the following locations, depending on team and project needs: Austin, Boulder, Boxborough, Bridgewater, Chandler, Irvine, New York City, Louisville, Raleigh, San Diego, Santa Clara, and Seattle.

Application Process

By applying here, you are expressing interest in one of our many 2026 Qualcomm Embedded Engineering internships. It is important to note that this is not a job posting for a specific project. We will review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out to you. Advancing candidates may be invited to complete a timed HackerRank challenge to evaluate their technical skill set.

To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Pay Range And Other Compensation & Benefits

$0.00 - $98.00

description:

What you'll do...

Requirements

‚Ä¢ 5+ years of professional experience in various elements of full stack software development ‚Äì native mobile, web front end, back end, and hands-on coding experience in the past
‚Ä¢ Experience with a consumer facing app and ecommerce or retail shopping
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience building scalable backend systems and platforms.
‚Ä¢ Designing and developing advanced applications using Java
‚Ä¢ Unit-testing code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability

‚Ä¢ Work with outside data sources and APIs
‚Ä¢ Experience with the agile methodology Scrum
‚Ä¢ Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
‚Ä¢ Proven software development experience and Java development
‚Ä¢ Experience translating wireframes into pixel-perfect views

description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...About the Role
Walmart‚Äôs Enterprise Business Services (EBS) within Global Tech powers critical financial systems at a massive scale. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will lead architecture, design, and delivery of next-generation Accounting & General Ledger platforms that ensure financial accuracy, compliance, and performance for the world‚Äôs largest retailer. This is your opportunity to set technical strategy, mentor engineers, and leverage emerging technologies‚Äîincluding AI‚Äîto transform enterprise finance.

What You‚Äôll Do
‚Ä¢ Lead Architecture & Design: Drive architecture and design for complex, enterprise-scale systems ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability. Set the vision for the area in alignment with enterprise and industry standards.
‚Ä¢ Technical Strategy & Standards: Define coding standards, enforce best practices, and guide decisions for performance, security, and observability.
‚Ä¢ AI-Driven Development: Champion AI-assisted tools (code generation, testing automation, intelligent monitoring) to improve velocity and quality.
‚Ä¢ Embed AI Features: Identify opportunities to integrate AI-driven capabilities into financial platforms and guide scalable implementation.
‚Ä¢ Full Lifecycle Ownership: Own design, coding, testing, CI/CD deployment, and operational excellence for mission-critical systems.
‚Ä¢ Cross-Team Collaboration: Partner with backend, frontend, and product teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with business objectives.
‚Ä¢ Mentorship & Leadership: Coach engineers, foster innovation, and promote engineering excellence across distributed teams.
‚Ä¢ Continuous Improvement: Evaluate emerging technologies (frontend, backend, AI) to evolve the stack and maintain competitive advantage.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and collaboration skills; ability to influence technical direction and drive AI adoption.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Experience with financial systems or ledger processing.

Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. At Walmart Global Tech, we are people-led and tech-powered, building solutions that redefine retail and finance at scale. Join us and make an impact that matters.

#PeratonIntern

Peraton is seeking Summer 2026 Software Engineer Interns to support our Internal Research & Development (IRAD) program which will be conducted in our Herndon, VA, West Lafayette, IN or Blacksburg, VA offices.

Join our Technology and Engineering Software Delivery Center and support exciting, advanced research projects in areas such as communications, space, cybersecurity, defense, health, and mobile. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work in a collaborative, supportive environment with our full-time staff, allowing you to grow your skills and your career while building experience in a variety of different projects and domains. You‚Äôll work in an Agile software development environment supporting requirements/story development, software architecture and design, software development, and unit/component testing. You‚Äôll also get the chance to obtain certifications in leading technologies to enhance your skills, such as Amazon Web Services.

We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the ten weeks (June to August) and commit to working a minimum of 35-40 hours per week. This program is geared toward technical college students, actively enrolled at a four-year university, who will be rising into their junior or senior years. However, strong underclassmen may be considered if they have declared their major and have completed qualified coursework.

title: Junior Software Developer
description:
Job Title: Junior Software Developer

Job Category: Information Technology

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: None

Employee Type: Regular

Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 25%

Type of Travel: Local
‚Ä¢ * *

The Opportunity:

CACI is seeking a versatile and skilled Software Junior Developer with expertise in both AI technologies and project management. This role will involve designing, coding, testing, and debugging software applications, with a focus on generative AI models and applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of software development principles, programming languages, and development tools, as well as the ability to manage projects according to predefined scope, schedule, budget, and quality standards. The developer will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions and innovative projects that leverage generative AI to create new content, enhance existing systems, and meet mission requirements. This position will also support FEMA Integrated Public Alert and Warning System (IPAWS) in leading the future of emergency communications with the public.

Responsibilities:

Software and Generative AI Development:
‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and maintain software applications and generative AL models in accordance with project requirements.
‚Ä¢ Serve as a key member of one or more prototyping teams, providing support to teammates and collaborating effectively to deliver functional software applications within tight deadlines.
‚Ä¢ Engage actively in all agile delivery phases and ceremonies, including release and sprint planning, artifact creation, sprint testing, demonstrations, and retrospectives, to ensure seamless project execution and continuous improvement.
‚Ä¢ Maintain a proactive stance in staying attuned to the latest advancements in AI technologies, tools, and best practices to ensure the application of cutting-edge solutions in project delivery.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate the capability to work autonomously on complex tasks with minimal direction and management oversight, showcasing initiative and self-motivation.
‚Ä¢ Adhere to coding standards and best practices and ensure the ethical use of generative AI technologies and adherence to data privacy standards.

Project Management:
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain detailed project plans, including scope, schedule, budget, and resource allocation.
‚Ä¢ Support project teams, providing guidance, support, and motivation to ensure project goals are met.
‚Ä¢ Ensure project deliverables are completed on time, within scope, and to the required quality standards.
‚Ä¢ Prepare and present project reports, dashboards, and documentation to stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Foster a collaborative environment and promote best practices in project management.

Qualifications:

Required:
‚Ä¢ Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain a Public Trust.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in software development, Computer Engineering, or a related development discipline.
‚Ä¢ Exhibit expertise in multiple programming languages, including but not limited to Python, Java, JavaScript, and TypeScript.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate proven experience with cloud services and platforms, such as AWS and Google Cloud, including the ability to deploy, manage, and scale applications effectively.
‚Ä¢ Maintain a solid understanding of cloud architecture principles.
‚Ä¢ Possess the ability to comprehend and manage API development and management processes.
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 3 years in software development, with proven expertise in programming languages such as Java, Python, C#, or similar, and experience with software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum).
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 3 years in generative AI development, including proven experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and generative models such as GANs, VAEs, and transformer-based models, along with a strong background in deep learning and neural networks.
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 2 years in project management, with a proven track record of successfully delivering projects, and experience in managing projects.
‚Ä¢ Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to understand API development and management.

A culture of integrity.

At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you‚Äôll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer‚Äôs missions and driven by a higher purpose ‚Äì to ensure the safety of our nation.

description:

Our division‚Äôs commitment to innovation and security enables us to provide critical solutions across defense, intelligence, and national security. Join our team and contribute to the next generation of defense technologies.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field (must be completed within 6 months from date posted) 6+ months of full- or part-time software engineering, system design, development, deployment, and testing experience No more than 5 years of relevant experience Software engineering skills in C++, Java, Python, web development, and/or scripting Familiarity with principles of software system design, development, deployment, and testing Familiarity with software development processes, including revision control, peer reviews, and documentation standards Ability to assist Program Managers, customers, and other system stakeholders as part of a software applications and solutions technical team Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to respond resourcefully to new demands or challenges Must be able to work effectively both independently and as part of a team Must be a US citizen and have an active Secret Clearance Must be able to travel as needed; nominal max is one 3-day trip every other month Preferred Qualifications: Academic or part-time experience working on a software development team Comfortable with using the Atlassian suite, including Confluence and Jira Comfortable using version control tools such as Git and Bitbucket Comfortable working in a Linux environment Experience with the Agile development framework *Salary Range $69,000 - $94,000Salary commensurate based on education and relevant experience

title: Advanced Software Engineer, Gameplay
description:
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery‚Ä¶ the stuff dreams are made of.

Who We Are‚Ä¶

When we say, ‚Äúthe stuff dreams are made of,‚Äù we‚Äôre not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD‚Äôs vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what‚Äôs next‚Ä¶

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

Avalanche is a Warner Bros. Games studio located in downtown Salt Lake City nestled against the backdrop of the beautiful Wasatch Mountains. We‚Äôve been in the video game business since 1995, creating interactive experiences for fans of the world‚Äôs largest franchises. Join the team behind the blockbuster open world, action RPG Hogwarts Legacy as we create what‚Äôs next!

The Job

Avalanche, a division of WB Games Inc., is seeking an Advanced Software Engineer to join our team of talented industry veterans working on a new online multiplayer RPG. This person will work closely with project engineering, art, and design leadership to develop high-quality, extensible gameplay features for an online multiplayer RPG.

The ideal candidate will own and support a variety of core gameplay systems, demonstrating high competency for gameplay and feature development and a true passion for game development.

What part will you play?
‚Ä¢ Develop and implement key gameplay systems and features, with a focus on building extensible architecture to support online, evolving gameplay in a live environment.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with the design team to build core gameplay systems and supporting tools.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with the project engineering team to architect and develop high quality, low-latency, and highly responsive code.
‚Ä¢ Participate in all parts of the development process from concept through to live-ops.
‚Ä¢ Develop and implement key game systems and features, as well as integrating with internal and external shared services and libraries.
‚Ä¢ Perform peer code reviews and champion a high standard of code excellence.
‚Ä¢ Mentor junior engineers and provide design guidance on new features.
‚Ä¢ Work with design and product teams for feature viability, costing, design completeness, and risk assessment.

What do we need from you?
‚Ä¢ 8+ years of professional software engineering experience, working on cross-functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Experience on at least one successfully-published large-scale multiplayer online game title or equivalent.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science (or a related field) or equivalent work experience.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in C++ (Templates, Exception Handling, Multi-Threading, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Experience managing a high functioning team of software engineers
‚Ä¢ Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, algorithms, and data structures.
‚Ä¢ Strong 3D Math (Linear Algebra, Vector/Matrix Math, Quaternions, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Proficient experience with the Unreal Engine (Core systems, player input, game modes, user interfaces, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Exceptional understanding of all game development disciplines and their inputs into the content pipeline.
‚Ä¢ Strong problem solving, debugging, and troubleshooting skills.

Good to Have
‚Ä¢ A passion for online multiplayer RPGs and deep experience with online games.
‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in online gaming.
‚Ä¢ Understanding of Performance Analysis and Optimizations.

How We Get Things Done‚Ä¶

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

Championing Inclusion at WBD
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

If you‚Äôre a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $151,200.00 - $280,800.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

If you‚Äôre a qualified candidate with an arrest or conviction record, please know that your application will be considered in accordance with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

title: Research Engineer, Universes
description:
About Anthropic

Anthropic‚Äôs mission is to create reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. We want AI to be safe and beneficial for our users and for society as a whole. Our team is a quickly growing group of committed researchers, engineers, policy experts, and business leaders working together to build beneficial AI systems.

About The Team

The Universes team within Research is responsible for training AI models to perform complex, difficult, long-horizon agentic tasks in ultra-realistic settings. We design and implement novel training environments that go far beyond what models can do today ‚Äî environments where models learn to navigate ambiguity, handle interruptions, maintain context over extended interactions, and exercise judgment in open-ended scenarios.

About The Role

We're looking for Research Engineers to help us build the next generation of training environments for capable and safe agentic AI.

This role blends research and engineering responsibilities, requiring you to both implement novel approaches and contribute to research direction. You'll work on fundamental research in reinforcement learning, designing training environments and methodologies that push the state of the art, and building evaluations that measure genuine capability.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Build the next generation of agentic environments
‚Ä¢ Build rigorous evaluations that measure real capability
‚Ä¢ Collaborate across research and infrastructure teams to ship environments into production training
‚Ä¢ Debug and iterate rapidly across research and production ML stacks
‚Ä¢ Contribute to research culture through technical discussions and collaborative problem-solving

You May Be a Good Fit If You
‚Ä¢ Are highly impact-driven ‚Äî you care about outcomes, not activity
‚Ä¢ Operate with high agency
‚Ä¢ Have good research taste or senior technical experience, demonstrating good judgment in identifying what actually matters in complex problem spaces
‚Ä¢ Can balance research exploration with engineering implementation
‚Ä¢ Are passionate about the potential impact of AI and are committed to developing safe and beneficial systems
‚Ä¢ Are comfortable with uncertainty and adapt quickly as the landscape shifts
‚Ä¢ Have strong software engineering skills and can build robust infrastructure
‚Ä¢ Enjoy pair programming (we love to pair!)

Strong candidates may also have one or more of the following:
‚Ä¢ Have industry experience with large language model training, fine-tuning or evaluation
‚Ä¢ Have industry experience building RL environments, simulation systems, or large-scale ML infrastructure
‚Ä¢ Senior experience in a relevant technical field even if transitioning domains
‚Ä¢ Deep expertise in sandboxing, containerization, VM infrastructure, or distributed systems
‚Ä¢ Published influential work in relevant ML areas

The annual compensation range for this role is listed below.

For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role.

Annual Salary

$500,000‚Äî$850,000 USD

Logistics

Education requirements: We require at least a Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.

Location-based hybrid policy: Currently, we expect all staff to be in one of our offices at least 25% of the time. However, some roles may require more time in our offices.

Visa sponsorship: We do sponsor visas! However, we aren't able to successfully sponsor visas for every role and every candidate. But if we make you an offer, we will make every reasonable effort to get you a visa, and we retain an immigration lawyer to help with this.

We encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification. Not all strong candidates will meet every single qualification as listed. Research shows that people who identify as being from underrepresented groups are more prone to experiencing imposter syndrome and doubting the strength of their candidacy, so we urge you not to exclude yourself prematurely and to submit an application if you're interested in this work. We think AI systems like the ones we're building have enormous social and ethical implications. We think this makes representation even more important, and we strive to include a range of diverse perspectives on our team.

Your safety matters to us. To protect yourself from potential scams, remember that Anthropic recruiters only contact you from @anthropic.com email addresses. In some cases, we may partner with vetted recruiting agencies who will identify themselves as working on behalf of Anthropic. Be cautious of emails from other domains. Legitimate Anthropic recruiters will never ask for money, fees, or banking information before your first day. If you're ever unsure about a communication, don't click any links‚Äîvisit anthropic.com/careers directly for confirmed position openings.

How We're Different

We believe that the highest-impact AI research will be big science. At Anthropic we work as a single cohesive team on just a few large-scale research efforts. And we value impact ‚Äî advancing our long-term goals of steerable, trustworthy AI ‚Äî rather than work on smaller and more specific puzzles. We view AI research as an empirical science, which has as much in common with physics and biology as with traditional efforts in computer science. We're an extremely collaborative group, and we host frequent research discussions to ensure that we are pursuing the highest-impact work at any given time. As such, we greatly value communication skills.

The easiest way to understand our research directions is to read our recent research. This research continues many of the directions our team worked on prior to Anthropic, including: GPT-3, Circuit-Based Interpretability, Multimodal Neurons, Scaling Laws, AI & Compute, Concrete Problems in AI Safety, and Learning from Human Preferences.

Come work with us!

Anthropic is a public benefit corporation headquartered in San Francisco. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, optional equity donation matching, generous vacation and parental leave, flexible working hours, and a lovely office space in which to collaborate with colleagues. Guidance on Candidates' AI Usage: Learn about our policy for using AI in our application process

title: Golang Software Engineer (Mid-level)
description:
At Jack Henry, we‚Äôre more than a technology company; we‚Äôre a force for good in financial services. We‚Äôre redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people-inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human-centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates. If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence, then we‚Äôd love to meet you.

We are seeking a Golang Engineer to join a team building backend services that support a new product that scales across our digital banking product suite. The team integrates internal data while leveraging permission based feature sets, enabling a UI of customer data across Jack Henry products. Your work building these tools will help push Jack Henry and our customers forward. It‚Äôs a highly collaborative group working cross-teams building next generation products.

This is a remote position, but candidates must live within approximately a 70-mile radius of our office locations in: Allen, TX; Birmingham, AL; Cedar Falls, IA; Charlotte, NC; Lenexa, KS; Louisville, KY; and Springfield/Monett, MO. Travel up to 5% for meetings and trainings may be required. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.

Salary range for this position is $100,000-140,000, depending on candidate experience and geographic location.

This position is ineligible for immigration sponsorship and support. Please do not apply if at any time you will need immigration support now or in the future (i.e., H-1B, STEM OPT Training Plans, etc.).

What you‚Äôll be responsible for:
‚Ä¢ Performs system analysis and programming activities which may require research and timely, effective, and quality delivery of software into production.
‚Ä¢ Performs technical/engineering support for new and existing applications from code delivery until the retirement of the application.
‚Ä¢ Develops, tests and reviews applications based on business requirements and industry best practices.
‚Ä¢ Uses best practices and standard guidance to create and modify code. Considers how code changes will affect end users and internal teams. May review code created by less experienced team members.
‚Ä¢ Performs work with cross-team as projects dictate.
‚Ä¢ Works on critical tasks and deliverables with no assistance, and sets and updates expectations on size, scope, and timelines.
‚Ä¢ Creates required technical documentation.
‚Ä¢ Stays updated with emerging technologies and industry trends, recommending innovative solutions to improve software development processes.
‚Ä¢ Adheres to documented departmental and corporate standards. Participates in the definition and documentation of standards.
‚Ä¢ Debugs and troubleshoots issues as they arise, providing timely resolutions.
‚Ä¢ May contribute to product architecture.
‚Ä¢ May perform other job duties as assigned.

What you‚Äôll need to have:
‚Ä¢ Minimum 4 years of back-end software engineering experience.
‚Ä¢ Professional experience programming in Golang.
‚Ä¢ Experience with SpannerDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL, or SQL Server.
‚Ä¢ Experience developing microservices and microservice architectures.
‚Ä¢ Experience with containerization and/or CI/CD practices.
‚Ä¢ Experience programming in a cloud environment (GCP, Azure, AWS).

What would be nice for you to have:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science.
‚Ä¢ Experience with SpiceDB or Google Zanzibar.
‚Ä¢ Experience with GitHub Actions and Kubernetes.
‚Ä¢ Experience utilizing observability tools such as Honeycomb or Datadog
‚Ä¢ Ability and passion to pick up and learn new programming languages and frameworks.
‚Ä¢ Self-motivation and the ability to work independently. A sense of ownership of your deliverables, from working with product managers and/or business analysts to define the scope, all the way through supporting your work in production. We take pride in the quality software we write as a team and want to work with someone who has the same level of care.

If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this opportunity. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement on this posting, we still encourage you to apply. We‚Äôre looking for passionate, driven individuals who align with our mission and can bring unique perspectives to our team.

Why Jack Henry?

At Jack Henry, we live by the motto: "Do the right thing, do whatever it takes, and have fun." It‚Äôs more than a tagline, it‚Äôs the foundation of our culture. We recognize that our associates are the key to our success, and we‚Äôre deeply committed to their wellbeing. That‚Äôs why we offer [1] comprehensive benefits designed to support your physical, mental, and financial health so you can thrive both personally and professionally.

We‚Äôre also leading the way in technology modernization, helping financial institutions evolve with speed, security, and flexibility. Our strategy focuses on delivering secure data access, mitigating fraud, and enabling seamless integration. Empowering our teams to build innovative solutions that meet the evolving needs of accountholders.

Culture of Commitment

Ask our associates why they love Jack Henry, and many will tell you it is because our culture is exceptional. We do great things together. Our culture empowers us to rise to challenges, seek new opportunities, and support one another through change. It‚Äôs this shared commitment that drives our success. We‚Äôre proud to foster an environment where inclusion, sustainability, and community impact are more than values, they‚Äôre how we operate. Visit our [2] Corporate Sustainability site to learn more about our culture and commitment to our people, customers, community, environment, and shareholders.

Equal Employment Opportunity

At Jack Henry, we know we are better together. We value, respect, and protect the uniqueness each of us brings. Innovation flourishes by including all voices and makes our business - and our society - stronger. Jack Henry is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing equal opportunity in all of our employment practices, including selection, hiring, performance management, promotion, transfer, compensation, benefits, education, training, social, and recreational activities to all persons regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, genetic information, pregnancy, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, and military and veteran status, or any other protected status protected by local, state or federal law.

title: Staff, Software Engineer - Full Stack Me@Campus
description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

Join Walmart as Staff Software Engineer ‚Äì Full Stack Me@Campus in our Global Technology EBS team. Your work could help over 240 million global customers live better every week. Yes, we are the Fortune #1 company. But you‚Äôll quickly find we‚Äôre a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Walmart is where the world‚Äôs most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. Join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in belonging, sustainability, and community involvement. From day one, you‚Äôll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life.

Walmart‚Äôs Enterprise Business Services (EBS) is a powerhouse of seven exceptional teams delivering world-class technology solutions and services making a profound impact at every level of Walmart. As a key part of Walmart Global Tech, our teams set the bar for operational excellence and leverage emerging technology to support millions of customers, associates, and stakeholders worldwide. Joining EBS means embarking on a journey of limitless growth, relentless innovation, and the chance to set new industry standards that shape the future of Walmart.

About the Team

The Me@Campus Core teams are responsible for the centralized platforms and processes leveraged by the Me@Campus mobile and desktop applications; a single, integrated experience for our campus-based associates. The Core Platforms team is responsible for all core services and integrations leveraged by the Me@Campus mobile and desktop core applications. This responsibility includes a wide variety of different technologies in the areas of application development, deployment, infrastructure management, observability and telemetry, performance testing, many more.

About the Role

As a Staff Full Stack Engineer at Walmart, you will play a key role in architecting and delivering highly scalable and performant applications that power both customer-facing and associate-facing experiences. You will leverage modern frontend and backend technologies to build seamless web and mobile applications, working closely with cross-functional teams to define technical direction, mentor engineers, and drive engineering excellence across the stack.

Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Design and build full stack applications using React Native (mobile and web)
‚Ä¢ Architect and implement scalable backend services and APIs (REST, GraphQL).
‚Ä¢ Model and optimize NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Couchbase, or similar) for high-availability and large-scale workloads.
‚Ä¢ Drive technical design discussions, code reviews, and platform-wide improvements.

‚Ä¢ Partner with product managers, designers, and backend teams to deliver end-to-end features.
‚Ä¢ Integrate CI/CD, automated testing, and monitoring into the development workflow.
‚Ä¢ Mentor engineers and contribute to technical strategy for web and mobile platforms.

Qualifications

‚Ä¢ 8+ years of professional software development experience, with deep expertise in full stack development.
‚Ä¢ Advanced proficiency in React Native (iOS/Android) and React Hooks for modern frontend development.
‚Ä¢ Strong backend development skills with experience in REST APIs and GraphQL.
‚Ä¢ Hands-on expertise with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB, or equivalent).
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of modern JavaScript/TypeScript and Node.js runtime.
‚Ä¢ Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and cloud deployments (AWS/GCP/Azure).
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to design scalable, reliable, and maintainable solutions.

Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Experience with state management libraries (Redux,, Apollo Client).
‚Ä¢ Experience with Cypress and R2 Automation Frameworks
‚Ä¢ Experience with Agentic AI Frameworks will be great.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with microservices and event-driven architectures (Kafka, Pub/Sub).
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of SQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL) alongside NoSQL systems.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of caching, performance tuning, and monitoring tools.
‚Ä¢ Contributions to open-source frameworks or libraries.

Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. title: Software Engineer II, Tax Product Development
description:
Job Summary

JOB DESCRIPTION

The Software Engineer II plays a pivotal role in designing and implementing advanced features and solutions that support the Tax practice and delivery of Tax services to clients. The Software Engineer II contributes as a senior developer and key member in an Agile team to design, develop, and implement innovative tax products and solutions to address complex business needs. This role requires effective collaboration with other team members, while also providing mentorship to junior developers.

Job Duties
‚Ä¢ Contributes as a senior developer and key member in an Agile team to design, develop, and implement innovative tax products and solutions to address complex business needs
‚Ä¢ Designs, develops, and tests software solutions using advanced web and cloud-based technologies and frameworks
‚Ä¢ Applies modern software engineering principles across the entire software lifecycle, including architecture, design, development, unit testing, code reviews, DevOps, defect remediation, troubleshooting, and release management, with a focus on best practices and efficiency
‚Ä¢ Reviews and analyzes business requirements to provide technical feasibility and accurate estimates, working closely with leads, business teams, clients, and other functional groups, to deliver high-quality software products
‚Ä¢ Mentors and guides junior engineers to enhance code quality and performance, and ensuring adherence to software engineering standards and compliance
‚Ä¢ Proactively escalates critical issues to management, and implements strategies for timely resolution, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills
‚Ä¢ Formulates and executes strategies, and develops comprehensive proposals for software design and architecture, contributing to the overall technical direction of the team
‚Ä¢ Other duties as required

Supervisory Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ N/A

Education

Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree required; focus in Computer Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM), Finance, or Accounting , preferred

Experience
‚Ä¢ Three (3) or more years of experience with developing web applications utilizing C#, ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScript frameworks (e.g., Angular, Typescript), React or similar, required
‚Ä¢ Three (3) or more years of experience with developing stored procedures and database schemas utilizing Azure SQL and Azure Cosmos DB or similar, preferred
‚Ä¢ Proficient in applying software engineering and object-oriented programming principles, preferred
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with building web-based apps using front-end and full stack skills, preferred
‚Ä¢ Experience with software design, algorithms, data structures, data modeling, and design patterns, preferred
‚Ä¢ Experience writing clean code, participating in code reviews, and minimizing technical debt, preferred
‚Ä¢ Foundational understanding of Agile solution development and DevOps skills, preferred
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with SQL Server and relational database concepts, preferred
‚Ä¢ Experience analyzing business requirements and process design, preferred
‚Ä¢ Experience providing solution support post Go-Live/Production, preferred

License/Certifications
‚Ä¢ Azure Fundamentals (Az-900) or Microsoft Developer Associate, preferred
‚Ä¢ Other certifications in Microsoft, Azure MTA / MCSD, preferred

Software
‚Ä¢ Experience with the following products, preferred:
‚Ä¢ Microsoft Office Suite
‚Ä¢ Microsoft Visual Studio
‚Ä¢ Microsoft Azure Dev Ops or GitHub
‚Ä¢ Microsoft SQL Server and/or Azure SQL DB
‚Ä¢ Microsoft SQL Reporting Services and/or Power BI
‚Ä¢ Microsoft SQL Integration Services and/or Azure Logic Apps
‚Ä¢ Microsoft Entity Framework
‚Ä¢ HTTP Debug Tools

Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
‚Ä¢ Strong verbal and written communication skills
‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal and customer relationship skills
‚Ä¢ Capacity to work in a deadline-driven environment while handling multiple complex projects/tasks simultaneously with a focus on details
‚Ä¢ Capable of successfully multi-tasking while working independently or within a group environment
‚Ä¢ Ability to rely on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals
‚Ä¢ Capable of working well under pressure while dealing with unexpected problems in a professional manner
‚Ä¢ Capacity to communicate and interact with all levels of employees and management
‚Ä¢ Ability to interact and build relationships and consensus among people
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of concepts, practices, and procedures within the software development industry
‚Ä¢ Strong information technology architectural and design skills
‚Ä¢ Solid project management and leadership skills to effectively act as technical lead on large projects
‚Ä¢ Capacity to consistently produce clean code and adhere to appropriate documentation standards

Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate‚Äôs qualifications, experience, skills, and geography.

National Range: $80,000 - $110,000

Maryland Range: $80,000 - $110,000

title: (USA) Senior, Software Engineer - Data Engineer
description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...IMMIGRATION SPONSORSHIP IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR THIS POSITION Role summary:

Walmart is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to design, develop, and maintain scalable software solutions that align with business objectives. This role involves analyzing requirements, creating detailed designs, coding, testing, and troubleshooting complex applications while ensuring high availability and security standards. The successful candidate will collaborate across teams to implement efficient DevOps practices and continuous integration processes. A strong foundation in software architecture, agile methodologies, and emerging technologies is essential to drive innovation and deliver reliable, maintainable software that supports Walmart‚Äôs evolving technical landscape.
About the team:

The Fusion-Microspace team focuses on space planning, assortment, and data analytics to support business objectives. This group collaborates closely to design and implement scalable software solutions, leveraging skills in software development, data engineering, and API integration. The team emphasizes agile methodologies and continuous improvement to deliver high-quality, maintainable applications. Members contribute to requirement analysis, solution design, coding, testing, and deployment, ensuring alignment with technical and business needs. The team fosters a professional environment that values expertise, innovation, and effective communication to achieve impactful results within the Walmart Group of Companies.
What you'll do:

title: Associate Software Engineer
description:
At Globus Medical, we move with a sense of urgency to deliver innovations that improve the quality of life of patients with musculoskeletal disorders. Our team is inspired by the needs of these patients, and the surgeons and healthcare providers who treat them. We embrace a culture of exceptional response by partnering with researchers and educators to transform clinical insights into tangible solutions. Our solutions improve the techniques and outcomes of surgery so patients can resume their lives as quickly as possible.

Associate Software Engineer

Globus Medical is looking for an Associate Software Engineer who is passionate about medical device development. You will be part of a pluri-disciplinary development team of 5 to 10 engineers, dedicated to the development of a complete surgical robotic system. You are a self-starter, detail-oriented, organized and deadline driven. You also possess strong communication skills, a ‚Äúroll your sleeves up‚Äù mentality and be able to work in an ‚Äúagile‚Äù structure with changing priorities. The job location will be at the Globus US Headquarter in Audubon, PA (near Philadelphia).

The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:
‚Ä¢ Designing and developing specific aspects of software modules or components for medical devices
‚Ä¢ Deploying, maintaining and updating full stack aspects of software application for medical devices on various platforms
‚Ä¢ Testing, debugging and troubleshooting software applications in a cadaveric and laboratory settings
‚Ä¢ Testing, debugging and troubleshooting KUKA based medical robotic systems
‚Ä¢ Contributing to and assisting with functional testing in cadaveric settings.
‚Ä¢ Managing all aspects of assigned tasks to ensure timely completion while remaining in full compliance with Globus software development environment (version control, toolchain, documentation tools) and quality system.
‚Ä¢ Executing software design verification procedures and assisting validation activities to ensure designs meet requirements.
‚Ä¢ Periodically attend surgical cases to understand context and end user requirements.
‚Ä¢ Adhering to the letter and spirit of the company Code of Conduct, the AdvaMed Code, MedTech Code, and all other company policies. Ensure Compliance with applicable governmental laws, rules, and regulations, both in the United States and internationally, by completing introductory and annual training and maintaining knowledge of compliance as it applies to your role.
‚Ä¢ Representing the company in a professional manner and uphold the highest standards of ethical business practices and socially responsible conduct in all interactions with other employees, customers, suppliers, and other third parties of Globus.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

To be qualified for this role, you must possess the following:
‚Ä¢ Proactive and autonomous mindset supported by problem solving skills.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and as a key contributor in small or large teams.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree with 0-2 years of professional programming experience or a Master‚Äôs degree.
‚Ä¢ Object oriented C++ development, including C++17 and later.
‚Ä¢ Development experience with or a willingness to learn Qt and QML.
‚Ä¢ Be comfortable using or be willing to learn standard software development environments (VisualStudio, VisualStudio Code) and GIT.
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of Windows, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Office, and E-mail.
‚Ä¢ Well organized, detail oriented and team player capable of working in a deadline dictated environment.
‚Ä¢ Excellent oral, written, and graphical communication skills. You will be interacting with English speaking colleagues located in the USA and Switzerland daily.
‚Ä¢ On-site job position.
‚Ä¢ Ability to travel up to 5% of the time and attend cadaver labs and surgeries in US and EU.

To be successful in this role, you need to have experience or be willing to learn the following:
‚Ä¢ Medical device or life science experiences are an asset.
‚Ä¢ Medical imaging equipment (e.g., X-ray, CT scans, MRI) experience is a big asset.
‚Ä¢ TDD (test driven development)

Insulet Corporation (NASDAQ: PODD), headquartered in Massachusetts, is an innovative medical device company dedicated to simplifying life for people with diabetes and other conditions through its Omnipod product platform. title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Who We Are: AM Pierce & Associates and Applied Technologies Group (ATG), a wholly owned subsidiary of AM Pierce and Associates, is a woman-owned small business providing Engineering & Research, Cyber, C5ISR, Program & Acquisition Management services and solutions to a diverse government and industry client base. We are a stable and growing company who offers our employees a rich benefits package, supportive and flexible work environment, and the opportunity to work with experts in their field.

The Position: We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Software Engineer to join our team, focused on autonomy software porting and integration.

Salary: The estimated salary range for this position is $80,000 - $100,000 annually, based upon an individual's level of experience, skillset, and education. The range that is given is an estimate and may vary based on contractual constraints. At AM Pierce & Associates, it is our goal to provide equitable compensation to all employees.

The Description:

The successful candidate will work closely with senior engineers and subject matter experts to port autonomy software from one baseline to another, ensuring the functionality and performance of the software remain consistent. This role is an excellent opportunity for recent graduates or early-career software engineers to gain experience in cutting-edge autonomy systems and software engineering practices.

‚Ä¢ Assist in porting and developing autonomy software components from one software baseline to another, ensuring compatibility and performance.

‚Ä¢ Good communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

Desired Skillset:

title: Senior Software Engineer -- ADAS Sensors
description:

title: Senior Software Engineer, Embedded Systems
description:

The Role:

General Motors is committed to creating a future with zero crashes, zero emissions, and zero congestion. We are working to make our world better, safer and more equitable to all. From start to finish, our engineering team challenges the limits on what is possible at all experiences. We welcome ambitious and passionate individuals who are ready to challenge limits and contribute to making the world a better place.

The Vehicle Mechatronics Embedded Controls (VMEC) organization is seeking Embedded Software developers, at various levels. These developers will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and deploying embedded software for significant projects that align with GM's future goals. Specifically, this role will focus on the Body domain, which encompasses essential vehicle systems and components responsible for managing vehicle motion, occupant protection, comfort, vision, visibility, and vehicle access.

What You‚Äôll do:

‚Ä¢ Identifying and resolving software issues and contributing to the team's knowledge base for future reference.
‚Ä¢ Archiving software components in GIT repository databases and coordinating retention efforts between controls and software teams.
‚Ä¢ Designing test cases to ensure comprehensive software testing at the unit, component, and integrated levels.

Your Skills & Abilities (Required Qualifications)

‚Ä¢ 6+ years of embedded software development experience
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in writing and debugging C code.
‚Ä¢ Strong oral and written communication skills as well as good interpersonal skills to work effectively in a geographically dispersed team.
‚Ä¢ Individually motivated; scrum team members are expected to pursue their goals with a high degree of independence and motivation.

What Will Give You A Competitive Edge (Preferred Skills)

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:

A self-starter, continuous learner and experienced technologist who transforms abstract ideas into actionable customer solutions, partnering across the company with engineers, product managers, business partners and executive stakeholders. Someone with a broad range of technical skills and enjoys the challenge of problem solving. Looking to spice things up with adding variety into your day vs. head's down coding.
